website_summaries.verdict: Protect yourself from both carbon monoxide and explosive gas buildup while you sleep with this inexpensive detector.
pros: Plug-in detector that monitors for carbon monoxide and explosive gas 24 hours a day
Alert sound is loud and can be heard from a distance
cons: If you experience a lot of blackouts, stock up on batteries — this option burns through them pretty fast
Some buyers report issues with this product not detecting some gases

customer_reviews.title: Easter Sunday, my family returned home to find a ...
customer_reviews.text: Easter Sunday, my family returned home to find a strong odor of gas. No alarm. CPS Energy responded as an emergency, found a severe leak, and capped. CPS Tech stated that alarm was properly installed, but clearly was not operating correctly.. Needless to say, I will be returning item...
customer_reviews.author: fredleopold

customer_reviews.title: Failed to detect PROPANE gas leak 2 feet away!!  Be afraid!!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter accidentally hit the stovetop button and moved it slightly on when she reached back to turn the oven on. We walked in the room 5 minutes later and smelt it bad! The Nighthawk was plugged in just 2 feet from the top of the stove for this exact purpose and IT DID NOT BEEP! When I pushed the "reset" button it detected gas and kept beeping like crazy, but NOTHING before. No beep, nothing! WASTE OF MONEY!! Product is faulty... never buy if you want to be safe from a propane gas leak.
customer_reviews.author: Dortma

customer_reviews.title: This Model appears to be defective - multiple units have exhibited the same defect.
customer_reviews.text: The hydrocarbon (methane, propane, etc.) detector did not work at all. Even in the setting of exposing the unit to 100% uncombusted methane, it did not register anything. As this is the second unit that exhibited this defect, I am highly suspicious that this Kidde model is simply unsuitable for natural gas detection.
customer_reviews.author: Tissue Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality unsure if product or retailer– not sold by amazon.
customer_reviews.text: Apparently not shipped and sold by amazon. When I plugged in the transformer, it blew up destroying my GFCI outlet. Magic smoke. I suppose it worked though, it had a melt down and I didn’t blow up. I guess there isn’t any explosive gas nearby.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Mine doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I had my gas meter changed yesterday. This detector was a foot away from the pipes when the meter was disconnected. The gas meter repairman let some gas out of the pipes as he replaced the meter. The detector failed to go off.
customer_reviews.author: Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Turned on the gas stove, waiting for a couple minutes, and the alarm went off just fine. Obviously we will not test CO carbon monoxide, because that’s way too dangerous; but for gas it works fine, so I assume for carbon monoxide it works just as well. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: PeterV

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite carbon monoxide detector. It works great. I have purchase in the past battery operated ones and found that I have to replace the batteries way to often but not with this one because you plug it in and it has a battery backup. I love the display. In fact the chimney for my natural gas furnace was messed up and the house filled with carbon monoxide. The fire department came in and check the levels. They compared there expensive detectornto rhis one and said this one was extremely accurate. I now own 3 of these. They saved my life.
customer_reviews.author: B.Brad

customer_reviews.title: Did not detect heavy Propane (LP) gas... at all.
customer_reviews.text: Recently had my propane service switched, and the blew out the lines, resulting in propane odor throughout my living room. The Kidde sensor didn’t detect it, although my wife and I could barely stand the odor in the house. My handheld sensor detected it immediately, going haywire... I fail this Kidde detector, as it fails at its most basic task - detecting flammable gas (propane in this case)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great product for your safety
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine product, that has a nice durable construction, and I like the readout and test functions, (plus battery backup for during power failures). While the versatile plug/cord combo allows different types of mounting - directly to plug, on shelf, or mounted on wall - I went for the wall mount option. There is ample cord to mount as high up as you need. I would recommend users to read best mounting practices for this type of monitoring device. Then decide what mounting or positioning style you want to use. I was happy enough with this purchase, I bought second, so I have one downstairs and upstairs. To me, a fair investment for your safety, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Didn't detect gas
customer_reviews.text: Have had this detector for over a year now. Mounted it directly above our gas stove in the kitchen. Twice now a knob on the front of the stove has been bumped inadvertently turning the gas on and filling the house with a strong gas odor. Not a peep out of the detector. Useless. And yes it was plugged in and on.
customer_reviews.author: East TN

customer_reviews.title: Great until we had to change the batter then false alarms galore.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until we changed the battery. Constantly gave false "GAS" alarms at all hours of the day and night. Had a tech come out to confirm no gas was in the home. Tried to move it to another location same thing. Plugged it in at a family member's house and same thing. Clearly there is not gas everywhere this thing was plugged in. I ended up getting another unit from the manufacturer after explaining the issue since mine became defective from a battery change. Not really confident in this detector now since apparently battery issues cause false alarms. Will be looking for something else if the next one starts alarming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Older date code :(  Chops +8-9 months off the warranty
customer_reviews.text: I received the unit just fine; it seems quite impressively heavy and industrial. The date code, however, is November of 2017 and, it is mid-August of 2018. I wrote the company days ago about this and have heard nothing except "we're looking into your issue". Basically, I asked for a newer unit that hadn't sat in a warehouse for 9 months or more. Thing is, these units expire over time and you have to replace them... they just wear out (something to do with the materials used to detect gasses). So - it might be a great unit but, poor customer service (so far) and I'm irritated they are shipping older units that cut time off the warranty period.
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Guy

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: I installed this detector six feet from my gas range. A range burner got bumped and spewed gas for hours one evening without the device alarming. The entire kitchen and dining room reeked to high heaven. Thank goodness I got up to use the bathroom and discovered it. I tested it with a portable propane torch and it took 6 seconds discharging directly into the sensor for it to alarm. It's going in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: fegeman

customer_reviews.title: Highly Disappointed and hoping they send me a replacement battery for ...
customer_reviews.text: Unit did not work properly. It stated "err" every single time I tried to connect the battery and plug it into the wall. Right out of the box and brand new. It didn't work and malfunctioned. Highly Disappointed and hoping they send me a replacement battery for FREE since the one that came with it isn't working properly according to the manual.
customer_reviews.author: kate  Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Better safe than sorry
customer_reviews.text: I had this brand for many years and it finally died. Therefore, I bought the same brand. I works very well. I have a gas stove and if one leans against the dials on the stove and moves, they can turn on the gas. I did have this happen, which is why I bought this alarm years about 11 years ago. A close neighbor smelled the gas while I was at work and ran in and opened windows. I thank her every time I see her. It did go off on me once, when I sprayed the house with Lysol disinfectant spray. It is extremely loud. I would wake anyone up if there was a gas leak.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Not for RV use!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace an RV detector that would go off constantly. After adding this one it never went off so I can't attest to it's accuracy. However if our travel trailer is not connected to shore power the 9 volt battery will only last about a day. If you're traveling during the day and plugging it in at night you'll probably get a few days out of a battery so you need a pocket full of batteries for a long trip. If anyone knows if it will function on a 12 volt system I'll permanently wire it in and change my review.
customer_reviews.author: A. B. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Does not work.  House filled with propane and unit did not go off and warn us.
customer_reviews.text: Left propane stove on for hours upstairs. We were in the basement and smelled propane. Upstairs was filled with propane and the unit did not alarm and registered nothing in the numbers on the unit. 0. I do not have a sense of smell. My husband smelled it. Had I been home alone I would have gone to bed unaware.
customer_reviews.author: gg

customer_reviews.title: They program them to clock out
customer_reviews.text: This is the third time I've replaced these over a 10 year period. I have two, one on each level of the house. Each time they've lasted about 5 years. I've been through a few false positives throughout the years but it's better to have them than not. Just hoping they are actually working. When they die, the show "end" on the display. They program them to clock out. Warranty is actually 5 years even though they proclaim 7 years.
customer_reviews.author: Woody1

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt operate off battery.
customer_reviews.text: Good product to have, but they shipped it to me with a dead battery. The unit was beeping with the provided battery. I put a new battery in, and the dying battery alert stopped. Updated review: 3/14. After replacing the battery and attempting to operate it off battery, the unit still beeps after unplugging, effectively not operating off a battery as it should, so we'll be returning this obviously defective unit and purchasing this type of product from another brand.
customer_reviews.author: James K.

customer_reviews.title: The sensor that came with my RV was too sensitive ...
customer_reviews.text: The sensor that came with my RV was too sensitive to the house battery condition and would go off during dry camping. I removed it, disconnected it and re-installed it to cover the hole, and I now use this one when dry camping. You will need to have replacement batteries on hand, though, because they're only supposed to be used as backup, and will probably not last more than a couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: Marne

customer_reviews.title: Makes us feel safer at home
customer_reviews.text: Gives my Wife and I lots of peace of mind for us and our pets. The siren is loud enough that it wakes me up. This is my second of this item as the first one got old and seemed to malfunction after about 8 years which actually it has a warning for. My original one was very sensitive to the water heater, so we moved it into an adjoining bathroom nearby the heater and water heater. Actually upon reading the new manual you are not supposed to put it in the same room as the heater/water heaters anyway. Hope to get 8 years out of this new one.
customer_reviews.author: ArvadaDude

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: You do have to read the instructions. It will sound when the gas level reaches the danger zone, but the display shows you the level at all times. I use two, one in the boiler room and one where propane enters the house for the dryer. One did go off once sensing another gas so they do work . YOu might consider unplugging and removing the backup battery if the electricity will be off for a while and no one will be home just to save the battery.
customer_reviews.author: lb8535

customer_reviews.title: Does not work properly
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product at work fine for about 2 months then after a power outage it refuses to reset. Battery has been replaced and every time we plug it in and it starts going off, even after you remove it to fresh air it keeps on going off I want a full refund on this thing
customer_reviews.author: GTG

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two, one for the kitchen and one for the basement near our water heater. Tested both independently. Turned the gas on the stove and in a matter of seconds it beeped loudly flashing GAS and the level. Every once in awhile my Husband would come home from work and when he walked in the door he would smell gas from one of the kids not turning the burner off all the way and when you're actually in the presence of it, it's sometimes hard to smell. Just had a home in our area that exploded due to gas and it just reminded us how important it is to have.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Q

customer_reviews.title: Good CO Detector (registers 0 since I got it) no leak yet to test
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to put about 10 feet away from my furnace so it’s in front of my bathroom and near the bedrooms. I plugged it into a regular height wall recepticale so it’s below knee level. I have a friend who had their smoke alarm/carbon monoxide detector mounted to their ceiling. It will be too late for their CO Detector to go off if it’s that high. I may get one of these for them to put near their inside basement door as their furnace is downstairs. May get for another friend as well. I could smell natural gas at her drier but she and her family couldn’t. They had a gas leak to the pipe to their dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis R.

customer_reviews.title: Essential for Elderly Folks
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for an existing unit at my mom's house. She had a small gas leak & it did alarm, so worth it's weight in gold. The only thing to be aware of is it will also pick up any kind of aerosol spray, so if you are installing for an elderly parent, be sure & let them know! Keep in mind your elderly mom/dad might forget to turn things off, so get them one of these.
customer_reviews.author: curly

customer_reviews.title: False alert, poor life expectancy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one of these two years ago and have not had any issues. A couple of weeks ago it started sounding and indicated there was gas in the house. I changed the batteries thinking it was just a bad battery but it still sounded. Had to call the gas company to come out and check for any leaks. Nothing was found. I took the device outside into the open air and it still went off indicating there was a high level of gas, which obviously wasn’t correct. Disappointed this didn’t even last half of its life expectancy but I guess better safe than sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK!
customer_reviews.text: Waist of money. The kids were making popcorn in the microwave just before bed for a sleepover and accidentally turned on the stove. 3 hours later the dog is the one who warned us of the issue. I woke up to him barking and pacing. Found the house smelled of gass. Found one of the burners on and hissing. Do not place your trust in this device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Felt 100% safe and secure with Kidde on guard.
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for the one I purchased in 1992. That unit sounded when it picked up gases being emitted from by a motor on the truck of the carpet cleaners that had parked in front of my house and ran hoses throughout my home cleaning the carpets. When the Kidde, which I have in the basement, sensed the fumes and went off, I checked unit for reading, and called the fire department who let us know what the problem was. If it had not been for the Kidde we could have been over come with the gases because we did not notice and smell.
customer_reviews.author: Rena Thomas

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these detectors and they actually work. Another brand failed to alert when the wind blown generator exhaust seeped into the basement. Make sure you understand where to mount the devices, it makes a huge difference, especially between detecting natural gas (lighter) or propane (heavier) than air.
customer_reviews.author: emanon

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than a Year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on April 6, 2019 and the unit just died yesterday, March 4, 2020. It did not even last a year. When I looked it up on-line they are supposed to last 7 to 10 years. The date on the item when it was manufactured is 2/18/2010. So the company sent me this item in 2019 after the item was already 9 years old. Please make sure you ask how old the item is before you purchase it. Thank you. Kim
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Low batter is constantly going off even with new batteries. Short return window.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't detect carbon monoxide 1' away from my exhaust pipe
customer_reviews.text: I am very unimpressed. I installed this in my tiny 1 car garage about a foot away from my tail pipe. And for a test, I closed the garage door and left the engine running. Ok, I know that was stupid but I wanted to see if this thing works. After waiting 5 minutes and still no alarm going off, I decided to turn off the car and open the door for some fresh air. I was going to test the gas detection but, what's the point, if it can't detect carbon monoxide, its going back!
customer_reviews.author: LesF

customer_reviews.title: Good value for safety and peace of mind.
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for the previous one I had for about ten years. It worked flawlessly until its end of life. This monitor as a built in EOL and goes into alarm with an EOL code. My original monitor, same model, never went into alarm, but I one noticed the display showing an increasing value. I shut down the boiler and discovered a defective burner. Repairs were made. I never had an event thereafter. The monitor saved me from carbon monoxide poisoning or possibly death. I recommend this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Tazbat

customer_reviews.title: Barely two months and stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this detector on Agust 28 2018, barely teo months and it just stopped working. There is a “lb” low battery error on lcd screen and it beeps every a few seconds. It makes no sense because it has been plugged to the electrical outlet since I bought and it just started doing that. I had to unplugged it to make it stop. Can’t serm to fund a solution and Amazon return window is closed. $50+ wasted and gone to the trash.. disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando R

customer_reviews.title: Most Versatile Gas Detector
customer_reviews.text: Lots of brands and models on the market to choose from. But this is the first one I found that was very practical and clever! The power transformer/plug unit snaps into the back of it. Allowing you to turn it 90 degrees if your wall receptacle needs it. It also can stay out and there's a couple feet of wire to mount it away from the receptacle. The digital display is large enough to see partway across the room. I have a ventless fireplace, so am interested to know about ANY levels of Carbon Monoxide - preferably BEFORE it reaches a predefined alarm level.
customer_reviews.author: kfairley

customer_reviews.title: Beware - if you order from Amazon you will get an old product!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered first week of September 2020. I received a product with a manufacture date of July 19, 2020 - more than a year old and into its warranty period. I read other reviews that say the same thing. Unfortunately you can't know what you are getting until you open the package. To Amazon's defense, I'm guessing they can't know how old the product is unless they cut it open and look. Manufacturer should write the date on the outside, but I guess they would sell less product that way.
customer_reviews.author: Jane D.

customer_reviews.title: Don't blow up your house as almost happened to me!
customer_reviews.text: Got because of ability to tell explosive gas. Why? Moved to new home & gas hot water heater wasn't working. Handy man worked on it when we discovered gas meter was OFF & LOCKED. Turns out city was changing to new meters but never notified me. So while they were coming out to turn gas on, handy man had to leave due to family emergency & forgot to tighten gas connection to heater. City turned gas on & checked for leaks and I left for 1.5 hrs only to come back to find garage filled w/gas. It happens! If u have gas u really do need this!
customer_reviews.author: jhawk1966

customer_reviews.title: No warning if unplugged
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well, my only complaint is that this model does not give you an audible warning if it's accidently unplugged like some of the older models did. So if it's unplugged, the battery will quickly drain and then the unit will be off without any audible warning. The older models had a sensor that would immediately and repeatedly tell you if it was unplugged with a loud warning. Sometimes people unplug them not knowing what it is, or because they need the outlet (or the dog knock it out) and the homeowner may not be aware that it isn't plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Ussel

customer_reviews.title: Top of the Line
customer_reviews.text: Didn't 'work' for 3 months, and I shelved it because I seem to overlook important details. The (new) 9V batteries I was attempting to use didn't have the juice so there was a constant error (LB) which means Low Battery. When purchasing, also buy the RECOMMENDED battery!  Now, it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Papa & Rosemary

customer_reviews.title: Great readable CO2 / Gas detector
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that you get a digital readout of any levels of CO2 / Gas that might be detected. Regular alarms just sound an alarm and it's too easy to ignore it. Some people will think that it's just a dead battery or defective unit especially since you can't smell CO2 and they just disable it so they can go back to sleep or whatever. Crazy as that sounds it happens so having an actual number appear is much more comforting for me knowing that whoever is in my house can know it's not just a bad unit or dead battery.
customer_reviews.author: mkd545

customer_reviews.title: No Issues So Far
customer_reviews.text: This device has been working well so far. PROS - Works well and seems pretty sensitive detection wise. (Opening the front door with a car running in the driveway will show about 10-16 PPM on the device, which is near the front door.) - Not overly expensive compared to other devices. - Detects explosive gas, which is a plus since I have a Propane stove. - Works fine with the Roost Smart Battery, which will notify your phone if the alarm sounds. Be careful though the battery portion of the Roost is $10 + shipping to replace, so if the power goes out you may run down the battery very fast. CONS - Nothing so far.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: I've owned a few of the same
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these in my kitchen and one on my basement for around 10 years. I have since moved but didn't take the detectors. When my apartment detector failed I did some reading and discovered that for the most part detectors all work the same way and all meet the necessary standards. So I bought the one that's easiest to read. Since I had good luck with the previous Kidde detectors it's the one I chose and I know from experience that they work... I've set them off a couple times doing foolish things.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Polaski

customer_reviews.title: INCREDIBLY LOUD!!! 🔊
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like the Kidde AC Plug-In Carbon Monoxide Detector! I did the test as recommended & it is incredibly load! It's so load it will hurt you or your pets ears if your to close! It says on the package it can detect Propane, Natural Gas & Carbon Monoxide! It plugs right into the wall & also comes with a 9 volt battery for backup power for when the lights go out!
customer_reviews.author: WilliamTop Contributor: Country Music

customer_reviews.title: Not sufficiently sensitive to natural gas
customer_reviews.text: I installed this detector (bottom in picture) close to my stove to alert in case of it leaking gas. I got it to replace my previous detector (top in picture), which worked well, but whose sound level became too low. Unfortunately, it does not seem to show anything when I tested leaking gas from the stove. The old detector showed a non-zero indicator, but the Kidde kept showing a zero. I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Podolsky

customer_reviews.title: Needs a different new battery if it keeps beeping
customer_reviews.text: My only issue with this alarm is that it seem to arrive with an old battery included inside of the packaging. The device started to constantly beep after the third day of use. I could not figure out what the problem was, as it was already plugged into a wall outlet for external power. It seems that if the internal back-up battery is weak, the alarm is start beeping. I switched it with a new battery and everything is working perfectly now.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Required if you have a fossil fuel appliance.
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for an almost exactly the same Kidde CO2 & Gas alarm that, after about ten years, chirped and indicated "end" (of its useful life). We bought the first one when a gas HVAC unit split the heat exchanger and almost killed us before we figured out what had happened. It was easy to install and seems to work well. We have only used its self-test and have not had CO2 or Gas problems to make it go off on its own. We now have an all-electric HVAC system and only need it for an LP gas backup fireplace.
customer_reviews.author: Capt Jim

customer_reviews.title: Beware of this product...
customer_reviews.text: After a gas scare bought this detector, installed it and within 36 hours it started to beep as if it had a low battery, Put in a new 9V battery and within 48 hours it started to beep once again as if it had a low battery..
customer_reviews.author: Mainiac

customer_reviews.title: Reliability of the product provides confidence.
customer_reviews.text: I have confidence in Kidde products since I have owned one for over 25 years. Twenty years ago my family was saved from carbon monoxide poisoning at 3:30 in the morning. The Kidde carbon monoxide detector I had purchased four years prior to this event at a bargain table at Cosco’s suddenly beeped and alerted us. Four years after I purchased this detector, it breathed its last breath (per se) with a very loud shrill voice to be heard by anyone and I would not look at any other brand for my protection. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Rowena B Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Picked up CO well
customer_reviews.text: We got this as we have a new gas stove. Installed it in the bedroom about 5' from the ground. Device picked up CO (it was within acceptable limits) through a closed door when we used the range and forgot to turn on the hood and recorded the peak value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good product
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 4 of these and only 3 worked properly. One of them kept going off, saying we had had a high level of gas detected, even in front of an open sliding glass door with a good breeze blowing, away from all gas sources! Pulled batteries out, reset, and tried it again with same results. The other 3 did not detect anything, gas or carbon monoxide.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: These "expire" in 10 years, but detect gas leaks too
customer_reviews.text: These units will stop working (and beep annoyingly to let you know) after 10 years of service. We have one on each floor, and knowing that they detect gas leaks is a huge benefit (we have gas heat, water heater, stove, and dryer). The only downside is the battery backup warning beep is so hard to isolate that we end up going crazy checking all the smoke detectors before we remember that these plug in units have battery backup
customer_reviews.author: Carol and David Melvin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Furnace Room Detector
customer_reviews.text: It’s the perfect thing for outside the furnace room in our basement. CO is heavier than air. If you want to be alerted early, put one of these as close to the ground as possible on the lowest level of your house. The battery backup in this one is nice too. The last one lasted 5+ years before it beeped and displayed “END.” Nicely done.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Worth It's Weight in Gold!
customer_reviews.text: Three years after we installed this, the alarm for gas went off in one of our rental units. Sure enough the hot water heater had a gas leak! Worth it's weight in Gold!! Am very thankful we had it installed. Note of caution. Operate it while plugged in; the battery in it is not intended to be used for every day use.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: in my kitchen, someone hit a knob on the ...
customer_reviews.text: in my kitchen, someone hit a knob on the stove, gas was slowly leaking for several hours, came home could smell the gas but nothing shown on sensor.
customer_reviews.author: Mick

customer_reviews.title: It failed in 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Unit is supposed to be good for 7 years with a 5 year warranty. Home Depot was great in giving a full credit for the failed unit.
customer_reviews.author: charles seider

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this because we had a gas leak from stove few days before and thought we need this to protect ourselves. However it could not detect the gas. Even if I place this next to the stove & leaked gas from the stove, this could not detect it while we can smell it in the living room a few meters away.
customer_reviews.author: Sai

customer_reviews.title: The king of detectors
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a gas leak yet so can't say for certain that it works but it is heavy duty and claims to do a lot. We like it and feel much safer and protected now. I Just felt like i couldnt be sure about those little battery operated carbon monoxide detectors. Anyways this one needs batteries AND and outlet. However I don't think it runs on batteries alone bc when we were moving we had it in a box and it beeped every few min. the whole time to alert us that its power source was missing.
customer_reviews.author: apedfish

customer_reviews.title: It is very loud as others have stated...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my daughter who has a propane stove in her rental home. Being new to propane appliances this provides me with some peace of mind incase she leaves the valve open without ignition. Something that has happened already. In testing the unit, she failed to see in the instructions where it states to cover your ears. She said it was extremely loud. I told her to wear ear plugs next time it needs testing. Since propane poisoning can put you in a stupor I think an extra loud alarm is a plus. Hoping this device will never be needed and will go old before it is needed as a warning alarm.
customer_reviews.author: smtireman

customer_reviews.title: A great unit for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I. Love. This. Unit. It's worth the cash. It brings me more peace of mind vs. the units that only read at 400+ ppm This alarms at 30 and will read anything over 11. You can't really expect lower readings without the pro equipment. This is the best CO detector I've purchased. Also works for propane & natural gas. I have it in my kiddo's room because we're right over the hot water heater and furnace in the basement. PRO TIP: Put your pet(s) outdoors before you test it. It's LOUD and painful (which is good if you've got CO but not good for dogs).
customer_reviews.author: CJ B.

customer_reviews.title: Nope Nope Nope
customer_reviews.text: What a COMPLETE WASTE OF MONEY! It is CRAP! It DOES NOT WORK! I just missed the return window however I will obtain a chargeback from my credit institution. This is false advertising and Deceptive Trade Practices.
customer_reviews.author: Flyn4fun

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you safe from gases
customer_reviews.text: Our generator sits outside in back of the cottage. During a prolonged summer storm related outage our old Nighthawk woke us with a alarm. The generators exhaust was seeping into the house. The old Nighthawk after many years gave out and was replaced with a new one. If we didn't have the unit I probably would not be writing this.......
customer_reviews.author: Michael K

customer_reviews.title: A highly rated fire / gas protection product
customer_reviews.text: We have these in the living space in our home and in the furnace room, as we have new propane heating and hot water systems in our single family home. Easy to read, the audible alarm will wake you and runs on AC from a standard 2 prong outlet and has a 9 volt battery backup in case of power failures. The device tells you when its time to replace the battery too. Visual notice and audible beeps.
customer_reviews.author: Steve V.

customer_reviews.title: reliable
customer_reviews.text: We just purchased our third unit. The previous 2 units lasted about 6-7 years each. It is easy to install and use. Just beware of the loudness of the alarm when it is tested. It is quite a bit louder than fire alarms that we have. Our grandson pressed the test button one time and learned to never touch it again all because of the noise.
customer_reviews.author: baker queen

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work properly and hard to understand the beeps
customer_reviews.text: This product is very confusing bit beeps (loud) for no reason at different intervals. When I look at the screen to see why it beeped, it says "0". So why does it beep for no reason waking us up in the middle of the night? Then, I wanted to see how sensitive it is. So I placed it near my Wolf stovetop (powerful stovetop) and tuned on the gas....nothing happened. It didn't beep and it didn't detect any gas. Disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to use in our camper and it works perfectly! I opted for the plug-in version instead of the 12 volt hard wired version a lot of people use in their campers, mainly because we don't boondock and I didn't want the hassle of trying to run new 12 volt wires to power it. This unit is perfect, you just connect the back-up battery inside it and then plug it in an outlet. So far we love it and it works silently and out of the way. I like the security now of having all 3 hazards monitored instead of only LP.
customer_reviews.author: Firefighter780

customer_reviews.title: Beeps constantly
customer_reviews.text: I wrote Kidde three times and never received any reply. The unit started beeping like it was a low battery shortly after buying. I tried changing the battery but it continues to beep. I emailed Kidde 3 times but they won't respond. I might as well return the unit if it won't function properly and the company refuses to respond.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great plug in gas detector.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and use. Set and forget like most alarms. It is a little on the large size but still allows use of both outlets. The alarm is extremely loud when testing the unit even with your hand over the speaker. Comes with 9v battery, hardware to mount on the wall and built in stand for counter top or floor use. The plug comes out and has a cord for counter top or wall use. Highly recommended and it is a quality name brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J.

customer_reviews.title: Won't tell you when there is gas
customer_reviews.text: Boiling water put out the flame on a burner, kitchen filled up with gas. Alarm, which sits 2 feet away from the burner, never went off. But when I push the test button, it warned of gas. But the kicker is that when I took it outside, into fresh air well away from from any source of gas and pushed the test button, it was still reading high levels of gas. Where there COULDNT have been gas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No longer works properly
customer_reviews.text: Bought after coming home to a horrible smell of natural gas with my kids and babysitter in house. We had a leak in water heater and they didn’t notice. We were lucky and got everyone out safely. Immediately bought the unit... It Worked for awhile and now alarm goes off stating low battery, we’ve replaced batteries multiple times and it’s always plugged in?? Something more we can do so this is usable?
customer_reviews.author: Loubyrd

customer_reviews.title: Unit expiry is terrible experience
customer_reviews.text: Unit seems to work fine, but what they don't tell you is that after 7 years it will basically just stop working with incessant beeping and no real grace period in which to order a replacement, which is crappy design in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Diggie

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy, it won’t save you.
customer_reviews.text: Just found out we’re having an issue with our heater blowing gas exhaust out. I smelled gas, then plugged this in directly next to our furnace and it didn’t alarm. Then I plugged it in directly next to my gas stove. I turned the gas on but didn’t light it, and the alarm never sounded even after an extended period. This does not work, I would not buy. I’m hoping I can still return it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver !!!
customer_reviews.text: Works well for replacing an OLD outdated RV gas detector that we think still works. However we don’t want to be neglecting safety, so I also have another combo detector on the ceiling with a ten year battery. I remote mounted & hid the power wire for a better location with this one. I like the digital display on both detectors.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES VANBIBBER

customer_reviews.title: Sent outdated product
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this and got it in April of 202 and they sent us an outdated product from 2015. We found this out when it started beeping and showing gas on it. The fire department came and said it was because machine was outdated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: False Alarm - Gas!
customer_reviews.text: This unit set off a "GAS" alarm almost immediately -- and repeatedly. There was no gas issue. What good is a unit that sounds false alarms like this? Should have studied the reviews more closely.
customer_reviews.author: sport

customer_reviews.title: Bought 3, 1 Alarms Constantly
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3. One for every level of the house as recommended. Within half an hour of installing, one started alarming. I reset it and switched it with another. The other two do not alarm in the same area. The seemingly faulty one alarms everywhere else I put it, even in places the other two do not.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Kiddie CO/Gas Detector
customer_reviews.text: My previous identical unit lasted almost 8 years. Directions indicated it would 7 years before it should be replaced. Very pleased with performance so purchased the same unit again, which should last another 7 years. Recommend mounting unit one foot from ceiling in area or room where installed.
customer_reviews.author: rcwall

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting, effective, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace old CO and explosive alarm that lasted longer than the 4 years advertised. What’s great is that the product tells you the end of its life. This replacement was at a good price and easy to install. You can switch the plug to fit your wall outlet. Alarm is loud and audible. We place in our upstairs hallway. Ideal location. Highly recommend product.
customer_reviews.author: L. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely designed gas monitor. You can plug it directly into a receptacle, or mount it elsewhere and use the included cord which is very neatly enclosed and stored inside the monitor. I can’t really attest to how well it works, as I haven’t actually “tested” it, but other reviewers that did test, claim it is very accurate at detecting explosive limits of gas.
customer_reviews.author: jchipps

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this in April 2017 for my travel trailer ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in April 2017 for my travel trailer. On my vacation in June 2017 it kept needing to be reset every time we moved from one place to another because it has to constantly have power, even though it has a battery backup (with a brand new battery). It was very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if you want it to detect natural gas leak.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two, returned two. If you want something to detect natural gas, do not buy it. I placed the unit right above gas stove, turned on gas, but the unit does not go off. Had it replaced, and the new unit still has the same issue. Returned again.
customer_reviews.author: LittlePenguin

customer_reviews.title: It does not work. Stay away
customer_reviews.text: Never worked and I was at risk all time. After a couple of kitchen emergencies, without the device recording any unusual reading or beeping, I ran a test. Opened the gas valve and let it flow for 20 seconds, with the Kidde just in front of it. I got nothing. Stay away from this product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for us!
customer_reviews.text: We initially bought separate detectors for natural gas and carbon monoxide after a gas scare, but then happened upon this three in one gadget. This was easily triggered when we placed it near the gas stove and let the natural gas run. It’s also easy to read. We are pleased with our purchase and glad we don’t have to have a bunch of our outlets occupied!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Too many false alarms!
customer_reviews.text: Too many false alarms! I use in the garage. I don't know if it's an end of life issue or just defective. I have had unit for a couple of years. I get explosive gas alarms when starting different vehicles with the garage doors open. I have come home to the alarm going off for gas, no leaks. Can't trust it so it's in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry from Chiswick

customer_reviews.title: Not made in China!
customer_reviews.text: This product I bought cause it wasn't made in China. I have always had first alerts, and our fire department recommended them so I stuck with them. I have had no problem in all the years required.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Arvio

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Had the prior model for 7 years until its end-of-life notification went off, replaced with this model.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these for my condo when my other one quit. I liked the gas sensor feature as a addition to the CO sensor. I liked it so much I started giving them away. I've given away five so far.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great Detector
customer_reviews.text: Great detector. Our old one was in the basement and due to physical limitations we decided to put it in our bedroom. Seems to work really good so far. The ONLY problem is it can be triggered by RF. The reason I know this I am a ham radio operator and when I work digital modes, I notice I set it off. We have not tried relocating it yet but that is an option.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Stuckey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and super easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Bought these a few months ago and love them. We plugged them straight into a wall socket, but they came with a cord as well if you don’t want them directly in the wall. Which is great because shortly after getting them we needed the space in an outlet and using the cord option keeps them from blocking the other outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Jess B

customer_reviews.title: HOPE I NEVER HAVE TO FIND OUT IF IT WORKS
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it senses both gas and carbon monoxide and alarm is very loud. It plugs into electrical outlet and has battery backup, I hope I never have to find out how it works.
customer_reviews.author: RON GRUBB

customer_reviews.title: First one defective
customer_reviews.text: The first one was defective and the first call in got a helpful person who walked me through a number of maneuvers. It got tedious since I had tried about all of the gambits she suggested, but eventually she authorized a return. The second one seems to be working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: J. F. Bridges

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Buy at your own risk. This thing lasted less than 2 months before it stopped working. It kept beeping because it thought the battery was dead, I put in 3 batteries and could not get it to work again. Now it's too late to return it.
customer_reviews.author: InternetGuru

customer_reviews.title: Kidde Is Apparently A Terrible Company
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this on Christmas Day 2018 after the old one (same model) malfunctioned. After receiving the product in the mail, it immediately malfunctioned. I contacted the manufacturer to file a warranty claim and have not recieved a replacement as of March 2019.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK this probably works but it's seriously ugly
customer_reviews.text: I know it can be seen from the product pictures, but this is really ugly. Red 7-segments LED display ? It feels like this item is straight from the 80s. Please Kidde, revisit the design... make something nicer looking ! Put a nicer display, one reading for each gas type. I'm not a designer but look at what Nest or Ecobee do for the thermostats and take inspiration. Please...
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: One out of 3 came sans battery; overall seems to work well.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a few for different locations. They seem to work well. Turned the stove on without going to ignite.. and it did detect the propane semi-quickly.... Only issue I had so far is 1 out of 3 did not come with batteries so far. The packaging was 100% intact before I opened it as well; so it likely came from the manufacturer that way.
customer_reviews.author: From New Hampsha

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install but loud
customer_reviews.text: I guess the loud is important but it's rough on your ears installing. I tried to not use a battery for backup as we have an automatic whole house generator but it alarms to let me know the battery is dead. I have no way of knowing if it works - and I hope it never has to alarm for us.
customer_reviews.author: MDOG

customer_reviews.title: Detects heavier than air gases.
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for those who utilize natural gas or propane for a heating fuel. These gases are heavier than air and sink to the lowest levels so having this detector about 15” above the floor will notify you of a collection of explosive gases. Another level of safety.
customer_reviews.author: T. Bard

customer_reviews.title: great for travel peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to take with us while traveling. We tend to rent homes when we travel and this gives us the peace of mind that if there were a gas or carbon monoxide problem we would be alerted. Warning it is extremely loud when you first plug it in and setting itself, so if you are sharing walls with anyone make sure to plug it in during the day. Also make sure to remove the battery when it is not plugged in so that it doesn't run down. You also can't take the battery on airlines.
customer_reviews.author: My Charming Story

customer_reviews.title: simple to install
customer_reviews.text: I read many of the reviews for this product and believe it is the best unit for our home. We use propane for cooking and for heating. As per the directions, we placed it low, plugging it into a wall socket with the 9 volt battery backup installed. The unit is easy to use and read.
customer_reviews.author: Duffer

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Cons: 1.Drains battery like crazy. When not connected to power - in a day. When connected to power in a month or 2. 2. Cannot test the natural gas detection. Called the company and asked. How do you trust it without testing? Pros: The display and alarms and looks are good. Returned the product.
customer_reviews.author: ManoR

product_meta.title: Kidde AC Plug-in Carbon Monoxide and Explosive Gas Detector Alarm | Nighthawk Sensor Technology | Model # KN-COEG-3
product_meta.description:
The Kidde KN-COEG-3 AC powered, plug-in CO and explosive gas alarm protects you and your family from two deadly threats. The KN-COEG-3 includes 9V battery backup that provides protection during a power outage, when AC-only units cannot provide protection. By pressing the Peak Level Button you can see the peak CO level recorded by the alarm since it was last reset or unplugged. The continuous digital display shows you the level of carbon monoxide (if any) the unit is sensing as well as if gas is present. The gas sensor is a metal oxide sensor designed to detect natural gas (methane) or propane. Temperature range- 40 degree Fahrenheit to 100 degree Fahrenheit.

AMAZON.COM
Protect your family from the dangers of carbon monoxide (CO), methane, and propane exposure with the Kidde KN-COEG-3 Nighthawk Plug-In Carbon Monoxide and Explosive Gas Alarm. The Nighthawk is an easy-to-install unit that provides reliable protection against the dangers of CO and explosive gas. The digital display shows if gas is present indicates CO levels in parts per million, allowing you to see if, how, and when levels change.



Advanced Technology in an Easy-to-Install, Plug-In Design
Designed for home use, the Kidde KN-COEG-3 Nighthawk is a UL-listed, A/C-powered, plug-in alarm that utilizes sophisticated electronic components and sensor technology to protect you and your family from the dangers of CO, methane, and propane exposure. It plugs directly into a standard A/C outlet and includes a 9-volt battery backup that provides continuous monitoring--even during power outages.The Dangers of Carbon Monoxide, Methane, and Propane Exposure
The leading cause of accidental poisoning deaths in North America, carbon monoxide (CO) is often referred to as the silent killer because it's odorless, tasteless, and invisible. Carbon monoxide poisoning can come about via a number of sources, including everyday items and appliances in your home or office. And because symptoms of CO poisoning mimic the flu or other common illnesses it can often go undiagnosed.

Likewise, methane and propane gases are commonly used in homes for cooking, heating, and water heating. Although it happens rarely, gas leaks can sometimes occur inside the home, increasing the risk of fire or explosion.

Audible Alarm Pattern Alerts you to Elevated CO and Gas Levels
When placed on every level of your home, alarms like the KN-COEG-3 Nighthawk can help protect everyone in the house by giving you an unmistakable signal when gas levels have reached an unhealthy point. If unhealthy levels of CO are detected, the alarm will emit four quick audible beeps every five seconds until either levels decrease or the reset button is pressed. If methane gas or propane gas is detected, the alarm will emit beeps every other second with "GAS" shown in the display.

Easy-to-Read Digital Display Shows CO Levels
The KN-COEG-3 Nighthawk is preferred among traditional CO and explosive gas alarms because of its digital display. This display clearly shows levels of CO that the unit has detected and stored-- from 30 to 999 ppm--and it updates every 15 seconds to indicate any abrupt changes or alarming trends. The display also shows the peak CO level recorded by the alarm since it was last reset or unplugged. The continuous display also shows if gas is present.

LED Shows Sensor Status
With the KN-COEG-3 Nighthawk, you never have to wonder if the sensor is functioning properly. A blinking dot in the lower right-hand corner of the display denotes normal operation, so you can trust that it's working. In addition, you can test alarm function by pressing the test/reset button at any time to verify that the horn and electric circuitry are operating properly.

Convenient Mounting Options
The KN-COEG-3 Nighthawk has a low-profile design that makes it suitable for any room in your home. The detector can be plugged into any standard A/C outlet; it's plug can be snapped into the back of the unit and can be rotated so the alarm remains vertical, independent of whether the electrical socket is mounted vertically or horizontally. In addition, the alarm comes with a 6-foot extension cord, so the unit can be plugged into the wall outlet and then placed on a table or shelf. For the most thorough protection, place an alarm on every level of your home.

The UL-listed Kidde KN-COEG-3 Nighthawk has a seven-year life and is backed by a five-year limited warranty.

About Kidde: A UTC Fire and Security Brand
Renowned for global leadership in fire detection and suppression, Kidde provides solutions ranging from portable fire extinguishers to advanced industrial controls such as flame detection and explosion suppression systems. Kidde is a UTC Fire and Security brand, with a history that's rich with innovations, from the patent of the Chubb Detector Lock in 1818 to the development of the world's first wireless networked smoke detectors in 2004.

What's in the Box
Kidde KN-COEG-3 Nighthawk Carbon Monoxide and Explosive Gas Alarm, 9-volt battery, mounting hardware, and installation guide.







FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The leading cause of accidental poisoning deaths in North America, Carbon Monoxide is odorless, tasteless and invisible. It is a silent killer. Kidde CO alarms include the most accurate sensing technology available, the patented Nighthawk electrochemical sensor. This unit is an AC powered, plug-in CO and explosive gas alarm that protects you and your family from two deadly threats. The 900-0113 includes 9V battery back up that provides protection during a power outage, when AC only units can not provide protection. By pressing the Peak Level Button you can see the peak CO level recorded by the alarm since it was last reset or unplugged. The continuous digital display shows you the level of carbon monoxide, if any. The unit is sensing as well as if gas is present. The gas sensor is a metal oxide sensor designed to detect natural gas , methane or propane. Install at least one CO alarm on every floor and in sleeping areas. Make sure CO alarms are at least 15 feet away from cooking or heating appliances to prevent false alarms. Replace CO alarms every 5 to 7 years to benefit from the latest technology upgrades.

See more
feature_bullets: Protects you and your family from two deadly threats: Carbon monoxide and explosive gas.
Sounder alarm – The KN-COEG-3 offers a loud 85-decibel pulsing alarm that will sound to alert you to a potential problem.
Digital display - Displays the level of carbon monoxide the unit is sensing.
Peak level memory - Recalls the highest CO concentration detected
Test/reset button - Tests unit’s electronic circuitry operation and allows you to immediately silence the alarm
Two alarms in one detects carbon monoxide and explosive gas
Digital display and peak level button displays the peak CO level recorded by the alarm since it was last reset
Kidde’s carbon monoxide alarms meet the requirements of Underwriters Laboratories (UL), an independent facility that tests products for compliance with widely-accepted safety standards

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,146 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
